page.title: 06The Caravan Site
page.content: The Clyde Valley Caravan Site is situated near the river. There are around fifty families who are permanent residents, though there are seventy residential caravans on the site. The site shop is closed, but there are plans to re-open it. At the present the residents use the shops in the village. There are three, only five minutes walk away. Most permanent residents have coal-fired central heating and tourist use calor gas. The electricity is supplied from the main grid. The permanent residents think it is like living in a little community, but they would like to see improvements in roads, water and wiring. Visitors find the site quiet and in attractive surroundings convenient for visiting Glasgow and Edinburgh and other important historical places.
